attributes.action: intervene to protect an important heritage site from a pernicious development application
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Before it was appropriated by compulsory purchase, Archery Gardens was a public open space and an important component of James Burton’s Regency ‘New Town’ of St Leonards, which he began in 1828. If this application is successful it will result in the construction of 163 dwellings in 7 industrialised blocks planted in the heart of Burtons' St Leonards. This development will dwarf many of the surrounding listed buildings and destroy a vital amenity and part of our architectural heritage.
